TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GlyphRun extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
type GlyphRun = class interface DUCE.IResource interface ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Represents a sequence of glyphs from a single face of a single font at a single size, and with a single rendering style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> object includes font details such as glyph indices and individual glyph positions. In addition, The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> object contains the original Unicode code points the run was generated from, character to glyph buffer offset mapping information, and per-character and per-glyph flags.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs> element represents the output of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> in XAML. The following markup syntax is used to describe the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs> element.
[!code-xaml[GlyphsOvwSample1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GlyphsOvwSample1/CS/default.xaml#1)]
Each glyph defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>. The following graphic defines the various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters.
![Diagraph of glyph measurements](~/add/media/glyph-example.png "Diagraph of glyph measurements") Various typographic qualities of two different glyph characters

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float32 pixelsPerDip) cil managed

Docs.param: The Pixels Per Density Independent Pixel value, which is the equivalent of the scale factor. For example, if the DPI of a screen is 120 (or 1.25 because 120/96 = 1.25) , 1.25 pixel per density independent pixel is drawn. DIP is the unit of measurement used by WPF to be independent of device resolution and DPIs.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property AdvanceWidths As IList(Of Double)
public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<double> ^ AdvanceWidths { System::Collections::Generic::IList<double> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<double> ^ value); };
member this.AdvanceWidths : System.Collections.Generic.IList<double> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of values that represent the advance widths corresponding to the glyph indices.
Docs.value: A list of values that represent the advance widths.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each item in the list of advance widths corresponds to the glyph values returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GlyphIndices%2A> property. The nominal origin of the n<sup>th</sup> glyph in the run (n>0) is the nominal origin of the n-1<sup>th</sup> glyph plus the n-1<sup>th</sup> advance width added along the runs advance vector. Base glyphs generally have a non-zero advance width, whereas combining glyphs generally have a zero advance width.

Docs.summary: Retrieves the for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> returned contains the combined geometry of all glyphs in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>. Overlapping contours are merged by performing a Boolean union operation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ClusterMap As IList(Of UShort)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ ClusterMap { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ value); };
member this.ClusterMap : System.Collections.Generic.IList<uint16> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of values that maps characters in the to glyph indices.
Docs.value: A list of values that represent mapped glyph indices.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There is one entry per character in the list. Each value in the list gives the offset of the first glyph, represented by <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GlyphIndices%2A>, to the corresponding character, represented by <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.Characters%2A>.
Where multiple characters map to a single glyph, or to a glyph group that cannot be broken down to map exactly to individual characters, the entries for all the characters have the same value: the offset of the first glyph that represents this group of characters.
If the list is `null` or equal to <xref:System.String.Empty>, sequential 1 to 1 mapping is assumed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DeviceFontName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DeviceFontName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specific device font for which the has been optimized.
Docs.value: A value that represents the device font.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> is rendered on a device that has built-in support for the named device font, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> should be rendered using a device specific mechanism for selecting that font, and by sending Unicode code points rather than glyph indices. When rendering onto a device that does not include built-in support for the named device font, <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.DeviceFontName%2A> should be ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit GetCaretCharacterHitFromDistance (double distance, out bool isInside);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit GetCaretCharacterHitFromDistance(float64 distance, [out] bool& isInside) cil managed
Public Function GetCaretCharacterHitFromDistance (distance As Double, ByRef isInside As Boolean) As CharacterHit

Docs.param: Offset to use for computing the caret character hit.
Determines whether the character hit is inside the .
Docs.summary: Retrieves the value that represents the character hit of the caret of the .
Docs.returns: A value that represents the character hit that is closest to the value. The out parameter returns if the character hit is inside the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `distance` value represents the offset from the leading edge of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
If the hit is outside the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>, the character hit represents the closest caret character hit within the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit> structure represents information about a character hit within a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> - the index of the first character that was hit as well as information about the leading or trailing edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance float64 GetDistanceFromCaretCharacterHit(valuetype System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit characterHit) cil managed
Public Function GetDistanceFromCaretCharacterHit (characterHit As CharacterHit) As Double

Docs.param: The to use for computing the offset.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the offset from the leading edge of the to the leading or trailing edge of a caret stop containing the specified character hit.
Docs.returns: A that represents the offset from the leading edge of the to the leading or trailing edge of a caret stop containing the character hit.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> is not hit testable, the distance of 0.0 is returned. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.IsHitTestable%2A> property to determine if a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> can be hit test.

Docs.exception: The character hit is outside the range specified by the Unicode string.

Docs.param: The to use for computing the next hit value.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the next valid caret character hit in the logical direction in the .
Docs.returns: A that represents the next valid caret character hit in the logical direction. If the return value is equal to , no further navigation is possible in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To retrieve the previous valid caret character hit, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GetPreviousCaretCharacterHit%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To retrieve the next valid caret character hit, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.GetNextCaretCharacterHit%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property GlyphIndices As IList(Of UShort)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ GlyphIndices { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::UInt16> ^ value); };
member this.GlyphIndices : System.Collections.Generic.IList<uint16> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of values that represent the glyph indices in the rendering physical font.
Docs.value: A list of values that represent the glyph indices.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of the glyph indices are defined by the font's character map table for the corresponding Unicode code points in the inner text.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property GlyphOffsets As IList(Of Point)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Windows::Point> ^ GlyphOffsets { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Windows::Point> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Windows::Point> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of values representing the offsets of the glyphs in the .
Docs.value: A list of values representing the offsets of glyph.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The glyph offset values are added to the nominal glyph origin to generate the final origin for the glyph. The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.AdvanceWidths%2A> property represents the values of the nominal glyph origins for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
Base glyphs generally have a glyph offset of (0, 0), combining glyphs generally have an offset that places them correctly on top of the nearest preceding base glyph.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to rotate glyphs.
Docs.value: if the glyphs are rotated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun.IsSideways%2A> is `true`, the glyphs that make up text characters are rotated 90° counter-clockwise, using vertical baseline positioning metrics.
